abstracts.cdata!:
The Enterprise and Financial Sector
            Adjustment Loan, in accordance with the Government's
            enterprise and financial sector reform program, comprised
            four components: a) restructuring and privatization of the
            banking system, but also including resolution of all
            troubled medium-sized banks; b) substantial strengthening of
            banking regulation and supervision; c) implementation of a
            strategy to resolve the large stock of problem loans taken
            off the books of the state banks; and, d) improving the
            legal framework, centered on the bankruptcy and collateral
            regime, and laws dealing with corporate governance. While
            rapid progress was made with implementation of the first two
            components, selected reforms supporting implementation of
            the last two components however, were noticeably slower to
            materialize. Therefore, release of the second tranche
            slipped from its original target date of early 2002, to well
            into 2003. Nonetheless, the pace of reform implementation
            accelerated noticeably during late 2002 and early 2003, also
            due to Slovakia's pending EU accession in May 2004,
            and, developments so far in 2003, and prospects for next
            year are encouraging. However, important risks remain: on
            the fiscal side, legislative changes relating to the
            spending reforms still need Parliament approval, and,
            outside the state budget, better control over municipalities
            and the health sector is needed, to avoid further slippages.
            Monetary policy continues to face a difficult balance
            between reducing inflation, and containing speculative
            capital inflows. Notwithstanding, progress against the
            second tranche release, and its conditions specified in the
            Loan Agreement have been met. In view of the overall
            performance, and progress with the implementation of the
            Program supported by the Loan, and in compliance with the
            specific conditions of release as described in Schedule 3,
            Section I of the Loan Agreement, the Bank has informed the
            Borrower of the availability of the second tranche of EURO
            70 million.
